CelestialBody

public protocol CelestialBody: ObjectBase

Basic properties of an orbiting object. Used by solar system planets, and the Earth’ Moon, and the Sun. Default implementation for planets is located in PlanetaryBase extension.

  • radiusVector

    The radius vector (=distance to the Sun)

    Declaration

    Swift

    var radiusVector: AstronomicalUnit
    Show on GitHub
  • eclipticCoordinates

    The ecliptic (=heliocentric) coordinates of the object

    Declaration

    Swift

    var eclipticCoordinates: EclipticCoordinates
    Show on GitHub
  • equatorialCoordinates

    The equatorial coordinates of the object

    Declaration

    Swift

    var equatorialCoordinates: EquatorialCoordinates
    Show on GitHub

  • riseTransitSetTimes(with:) Default implementation

    Returns the Rise, Transit and Set times of the body for a given location on Earth.

    Default Implementation

    Geometric altitude (h0) of the center of the body at time of apparent rising or setting (see AA p.101)

    Declaration

    Swift

    func riseTransitSetTimes(with geographicCoordinates: GeographicCoordinates) -> RiseTransitSetTimes

    Parameters

    geographicCoordinates

    The coordinates of the location on Earth.

    Return Value

    A RiseTransitSetTimes object.

    Show on GitHub
  • hourAngle(with:) Default implementation

    Returns the Hour Angle of the celestial body, that is, the difference between its local mean sidereal time and its right ascension.

    Default Implementation

    Geometric altitude (h0) of the center of the body at time of apparent rising or setting (see AA p.101)

    Declaration

    Swift

    func hourAngle(with geographicCoordinates: GeographicCoordinates) -> Hour

    Parameters

    geographicCoordinates

    The geographic coordinates of the place.

    Return Value

    The Hour Angle of the body.

    Show on GitHub

  • diurnalArcAngle(forObjectAltitude:coordinates:) Default implementation

    The angle the Earth must make between the time at which the object is at a given altitude, then rotate, produce a diurnal arc, and reach a time at which the object reached again the same altitude. Basically, for the object being the Sun, and the altitude being 0=horizon, compute the angle between sunrise and sunset.

    Default Implementation

    Geometric altitude (h0) of the center of the body at time of apparent rising or setting (see AA p.101)

    Declaration

    Swift

    func diurnalArcAngle(forObjectAltitude altitude: Degree, coordinates: GeographicCoordinates) -> (value: Degree?, error: CelestialBodyTransitError?)

    Parameters

    altitude

    The crossing altitude
    coordinates

    The point on Earth from which one computes the arc.

    Return Value

    The angle of the so-called diurnal arc

    Show on GitHub
